I'm trying to author a JUnit-based test scenario where the input to a
singl=
e test case is a file name. However, the test case needs to
recursively run=
 against, say, the names of all the files in a folder
and its subfolders.

=
Each file is a different test case, but the number, type and content
of fil=
es during each run will differ.

I don't want to pass all the files into my=
 testXXX method in one shot
because that would mean the following:
- Semant=
ically, it would be the equivalent of a single test case, not
multiple, and=

- The test case would abort the moment it failed on a single file
instead =
of running through all the files (like I want it to)

I haven't seen this a=
ddressed anywhere. How do I achieve this? What is
the best/recommended way =
to write/execute a single JUnit test case
with a sequence of multiple, vary=
ing inputs?
